sentence.Network_en: The bus is said to have over-turned and fallen into a ravine.
sentence.Network_cn: 据说巴士发生翻车，跌进了峡谷。

sentence.Network_en: The straight flow of the brook formed a ravine.
sentence.Network_cn: 不间断的溪水形成了一个峡谷.

sentence.Network_en: The river had worn a ravine between the hills.
sentence.Network_cn: 那条河在两山之间已造成一个深谷.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from French, violent rush (of water') (see ravin)

entry.def: A ravine is a very deep narrow valley with steep sides.

example.ex: The bus is said to have overturned and fallen into a ravine.
example.tran: 据说巴士发生翻车，跌进了峡谷。

means.word_mean: 1. a deep narrow steep-sided valley (especially one formed by running water)

auth_sentence.content: Light flickered on a tiny stream in a ravine.

auth_sentence.content: He led me down a steep ravine to a creek.

means.word_mean: 既深又狭、坡度很大的山谷

sentences.en: The city is built on the rock rising out of ravines.
sentences.cn: 这座城市建在高出峡谷的岩石上。
